availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles K. Metcalf (Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and Corporal in the 17th Kentucky US)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Pricie Ambrose Metcalf. Father to Mary E. Metcalf and Ida E. Metcalf Bean. Farmer in Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860. Served as a corporal in Company G of the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from January 4, 1862 to April 12, 1862. Served as a corporal in Company G of the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from April 12, 1862 to January 4, 1864. Died in Chattanooga on January 4, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 2, p. 92A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Adams Fork, p. 523.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #21261.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 966-7.
"Charles K. Metcalf (d. 1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #2988700, accessed September 13, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/2988700.
